sentences.english: Bald eagles and ospreys roost in the old cottonwoods that line the gravel shores.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷹和魚鷹在礫石河岸邊的棉白楊林中棲息下來。

sentences.english: Objective To establish a method for the determination of chrysin-7-glucoside in Nalussieboldji.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立三葉海棠葉中白楊素苷含量測定方法。

sentences.english: The leaves of the poplar trees rustled in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 風吹着白楊樹葉沙沙地響。

sentences.english: Yellow aspen leaves reflect brightly off the morning sun.
sentences.chinese: 黃色白楊樹葉明亮地反映了即將離去的早晨太陽。

sentences.english: Night wind Department, poplar leaves rustles, they are singing from the songs?
sentences.chinese: 夜風處，白楊樹的葉子沙沙響，它們是在吟唱離歌嗎？

sentences.english: Erect poplars lined both sides of the road.
sentences.chinese: 道路兩旁筆直的白楊排成行。

sentences.english: In central Georgia, sweetgum and poplar trees grow in large numbers.
sentences.chinese: 在佐治亞州中部，生長有大量的楓香樹和白楊樹。

sentences.english: On the east side of the building, there is a promenade with an old growth poplar forest which acts as a windbreaker.
sentences.chinese: 在建築的東邊，由散佈的原始白楊林充當防護林。

sentences.english: The yield from aspen timber is best when relatively short components of sawn wood can be utilized.
sentences.chinese: 當短的鋸木部件可被利用時，白楊可以達到最佳產量。

sentences.english: There are two rows of aspens on either side of the streets.
sentences.chinese: 道路的兩邊分列着整齊的白楊樹。

sentences.english: So the insect-resistance of transgenic male poplar was improved.
sentences.chinese: 從而提高了該轉基因毛白楊雄株的抗蟲性。

sentences.english: Whereas morin and chrysin displayed a similar effect to DRB.
sentences.chinese: 而桑色素和白楊黃素的作用效果接近於DRB。

sentences.english: I eulogize the tall and straight trunk of the white poplar.
sentences.chinese: 我讚美白楊樹那挺拔的樹幹。

sentences.english: An aspen leaf turning fall colors.
sentences.chinese: 白楊樹的樹葉轉變爲秋天的顏色。

sentences.english: Praise of White Poplar is a famous essay of Mao Dun .
sentences.chinese: 《白楊禮讚》是茅盾先生的散文名篇。

sentences.english: Poplar leaves is not reversed pendulum, and I never dejected life.
sentences.chinese: 白楊樹沒有倒垂的葉片，我也從沒有垂頭喪氣的日子。

definition: soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
evergreen pine and cypress (idiom); steadfast nobility
to be shaded or concealed by foliage/to conceal/hidden/covert/shade (of a tree)
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
